an1.211:1.1: BB takes this to be pick up a meal ticket, but why is this a good thing? I think it means he “breaks the ice” at Sangha meetings, and encourages due process by initiating the vote.
an1.217:1.1: “Kassapa the Prince” (Kumārakassapa) was ordained at twenty ([pli-tv-kd1:75.1.1]()). He features in the Pāyāsisutta ([dn23]()), the Vammikasutta ([mn23]()), and his verses are collected in the Theragāthā ([thag2.41]()). His distinction here is apparently in recognition of the elaborate skills displayed in the Pāyāsisutta. Since that sutta begins without mentioning the Buddha, however, it was probably spoken after the Buddha’s passing (see commentary to Vimānavatthu 74), so his addition here must have been later still.
